title: How the Trump Administration Rushed to Judgment in Minneapolis Shooting
summary: The administration was in a race to control the narrative around the killing of Alex Pretti, even as videos emerged that contradicted the government’s account.

title: Killing Prompts Only a Defiant Response From Trump
summary: Even as the second death of a protester in Minnesota brought demands for accountability, the president, insulated from dissenting voices, stuck to his pattern of reflexively blaming opponents.

title: Mamdani Clears Early Hurdles as Storm Bears Down on New York
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani made use of his strong communication skills, and the Sanitation Department said every road was plowed at least twice by Sunday evening.

title: Xi’s Purge of China’s Military Brings Its Top General Down
summary: The ouster of Gen. Zhang Youxia, who was second only to Xi Jinping in the military hierarchy, marks “the total annihilation of the high command,” one analyst said.

title: As Europe’s Reliance on U.S. Natural Gas Grows, So Does Trump’s Leverage
summary: Tension over Greenland has prompted worries that the Trump administration could turn the U.S. oil and gas industry into a way to pressure Europe.

title: For Greenland Tourism, Trump’s Interest Creates Uncertainty
summary: Bookings to the island increased last year, and there are plans for two new airports. Threats from President Trump may change that.

title: The Taliban Say They’re Ready to Release U.S. Prisoners. But Which Ones?
summary: Top Afghan officials say they want two American detainees released “as soon as possible,” but the Trump administration says a third one should be included.

title: Columbia Selects University of Wisconsin Chancellor as Its President
summary: Jennifer Mnookin has led the flagship campus of the state university system since 2022. She takes the helm at Columbia after a tumultuous period.

title: In Venezuela, Families Search for Relatives Who Are Detained and Missing
summary: Even as dozens of political prisoners have been freed, at least 66 people taken by state authorities and never heard from again remain missing, relatives and rights groups say.

title: Travel Math: When Flying Costs as Much as the Train, Who Wins?
summary: Amtrak says dynamic pricing has helped strengthen its finances, but travelers often grumble at the cost, especially for last-minute travel. Still, the train has a secret weapon: avoiding the airport.

title: Fashion Is Exaggerating the Female Form Like Never Before. What Is Going On?
summary: Fashion has begun exaggerating, or distorting, the female form like never before. What exactly is going on?

title: The Trump Administration Is Lying to Our Faces. Congress Must Act.
summary: The Trump administration is once again engaged in a perversion of justice.

title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Is Stuck in the 16th Century
summary: The president’s approach is not just chaos or an updated version of 19th-century great-power competition.

title: At Least 15 Dead After Ferry Carrying 350 Sinks in the Philippines
summary: It was not immediately clear how many people were missing after the ferry sank early Monday morning in Basilan Province.

title: Eleanor Holmes Norton Files to End Re-election Campaign
summary: It was not clear whether Washington’s 88-year-old veteran delegate, who has been in declining health but has insisted she would seek re-election, was aware of the filing.

title: In Visits to Dealerships, Pair Schemed to Steal High-End Vehicles, Police Say
summary: An organized theft ring in Connecticut, New Jersey and New York swapped or quickly cloned key fobs to steal millions of dollars’ worth of vehicles, officials said.
